_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Installed a new ammonia tank truck unloading facility to use if the pipeline is unavailable

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Ascend Performance Materials - Chocolate Bayou - Alvin, TX                                                          12/17/2015

Ascend Performance Materials (APM) has officially adopted the following six commitments, expressing our intention to operate responsibly.  
1.  We will ensure that our operations and distribution systems are safe for employees, visitors, site contractors, communities and the environment.
2.  We will make products that are safe when used responsibly.
3.  We will keep our operations open to our communities and foster open communications with all of our stakeholders.
4.  We will continuously improve our raw material and energy utilization efficiencies, to reduce our impact on the environment and improve the sustainability of our businesses.
5.  We will encourage active participation in and positive contributions to safety, health and environmental stewardship by our employees.
6.  We will search worldwide for new technologies that bring environmental, safety and health value to all of our stakeholders.

By acting on these commitments, we expect to match the best practices of our peer companies and to adhere to the Responsible Care guidelines developed by the American Chemical Council.  We are an OSHA Voluntary Protection Plan (VPP) Star Site and ISO 14001 certified.
 
1.0 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
APM Chocolate Bayou has a long and proud history of maintaining our processes in a safe and responsible manner.  We use a combination of accidental release prevention programs and emergency response planning programs to protect our employees, the environment, and the community.  This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.

2.0 Stationary Source and Regulated Substances
Our facility produces a variety of chemicals.  APM operates and manages the facility while the four guest companies own unit assets operated and manage

d by APM personnel.  Of the ten total processing units at the facility, eight handle chemicals covered under the RMP.  

3.0 Key Offsite Consequence Analysis Scenarios
APM used RMP*Comp to model potential consequences as required in the RMP rule.  The specifics of the Worst and Alternative cases are provided in the update.  

4.0 General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
We take a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases of hazardous chemicals.  Our management systems address all elements of the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) regulations.  Chemical specific monitoring devices, response protocols, material of construction, process interlocks, and operator training combine to mitigate the inherent risks. 

5.0  Five-year Accident History
We keep records for all significant accidental chemical releases that occur at our facility.   In the past five years we have had no incident involving materials covered under EPA's RMP rule that meet the reporting requirements set forth in the program.  

6.0 Emergency Response Program
We maintain an integrated contingency plan (ICP) that consolidates all of the various federal, State of Texas, and local regulatory requirements for emergency response planning.  It covers emergency planning, training, and coordinating with the community emergency response plan.  

7.0 Ongoing Changes for Continuous Improvement to Safety
The following is a list of ongoing improvements that we are implementing at the facility to help prevent and/or better respond to accidental chemical releases:
a.	Maintain a capital and maintenance program to enhance reliability of operating units, therefore reducing upset conditions.
b.	Maintain OSHA Star Status
c.	Maintain ISO 14000 Status

8.0 Certification
APM Chocolate Bayou has no Program 1 or 2 processes.  To the best of the undersigned's knowledge, information, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the informatio

n submitted is true, accurate, and complete.
                                                                                           
_________________________________________________     November 20, 2015
Paul Cartlidge
Ascend Performance Materials Chocolate Bayou Plant Manager
